properties.Name: MasterContract
properties.Description:
In Group Insurance, the Master Contract is given to the employer or participating organization.

Individuals (Policyholders) insured under the plan receive certificates to evidence their coverage under the plan.

The basic principle of group insurance is that it provides insurance coverage for a number of people under a single master contract or master policy.

It is the group that must meet the underwriting requirements of the insurance company - not the individual members.

Group insurance is a way to provide life insurance to a large number of people under a single contract ('master contract' or 'master policy').

Group insurance is typically provided by an employer for their employees as a benefit. The employer is the applicant and the contract policyholder. The employees are group members and not parties to the contract. Each employee is given a certificate of insurance that summarizes the  coverage terms and details the  employee's rights under the  contract.

Columns.Name: MasterContractId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Master Contract.

Columns.Name: ContractSignedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Master Contract was signed.

Columns.Name: ContractEffectiveStartDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Master Contract goes into effect.

Columns.Name: ContractEffectiveEndDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Master Contract is terminated or expires.

Columns.Name: ContractPeriodMonths
Columns.Description: The number of months that the Master Contract is to be in effect.

Columns.Name: AutomaticRenewalIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the Master Contract is to be automatically renewed upon expiration.

Columns.Name: AutomaticRenewalNotificationPeriod
Columns.Description: The period in days in which the Master Contract holder is to be notified in advance that the Master Contract is due to expire.

Columns.Name: PrepaidContractIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the Master Contract is prepaid by the Master Contract holder.

Columns.Name: AnnuallyRenewableIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the Master Contract can be renewed on an annual basis.

Columns.Name: EligibilityStatement
Columns.Description: The eligibility criteria associated with membership under the Master Contract.

Columns.Name: ConversionToIndividualPlanIndicator
Columns.Description: Most group life insurance policies contain a conversion provision that allows individuals to convert to an individual insurance plan without evidence of insurability within a specified period of days.

Columns.Name: ConversionToIndividualPlanPeriod
Columns.Description:
The number of days in which the individual has to convert from the group to individual insurance plan.

Most group life insurance policies contain a conversion provision that allows individuals to convert to an individual insurance plan without evidence of insurability within a specified period of days.

Columns.Name: MasterContractTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Contract Type.

Columns.Name: SponsorId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Sponsor.

Properties.Description:
In Group Insurance, the Master Contract is given to the employer or participating organization.

Individuals (Policyholders) insured under the plan receive certificates to evidence their coverage under the plan.

The basic principle of group insurance is that it provides insurance coverage for a number of people under a single master contract or master policy.

It is the group that must meet the underwriting requirements of the insurance company - not the individual members.

Group insurance is a way to provide life insurance to a large number of people under a single contract ('master contract' or 'master policy').

Group insurance is typically provided by an employer for their employees as a benefit. The employer is the applicant and the contract policyholder. The employees are group members and not parties to the contract. Each employee is given a certificate of insurance that summarizes the  coverage terms and details the  employee's rights under the  contract.
